intro: Sidalcea asprella, commonly known as the rough sidalcea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Its root system forms symbiotic relationships with nitrogen-fixing bacteria, enhancing soil fertility. Sidalcea asprella is often found in open grasslands and along streambanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
